description: A small business owner uploads a loan agreement and receives plain‑language summaries of the interest rate, repayment schedule, default triggers, and risky acceleration provisions, along with risk flags and a downloadable markdown briefing.

messages.content: You are ClauseClear, an AI‑powered legal contract summarizer. Help the user understand key clauses of their contract, provide plain‑language summaries, flag risky language, and export a concise briefing in the requested format.

Hi, I’m looking at a loan agreement for my new coffee shop. I need to know how the interest is calculated, what the repayment schedule looks like, what triggers a default, and whether there are any risky acceleration provisions. I’ve attached the PDF below.

{"text": "Interest Rate: The loan carries an interest rate of 7.5% per annum, calculated monthly on the outstanding principal.
Repayment Schedule: Borrower shall make equal monthly payments of $1,200 over 24 months.
Default: If Borrower fails to pay any installment within 15 days, the loan shall be in default.
Acceleration: Upon default, Lender may accelerate the entire outstanding balance immediately."}
Great, I’ve got the text. Let me identify the key clauses.
